li.a: Bylaws & Policies for Board of Ed

span.p: Many of you are probably aware of Governor Murphy’s decision on Thursday to keep schools closed until at least May 15th. While we greatly miss our students, we also know that government officials are working closely with medical experts to ensure the safety of our students/staff.

Early this week, district administrators will be reviewing our current Flexible Instruction Plan to ensure that we continue to be at the forefront of delivering a quality instructional program to our students for at least the next four weeks. We truly appreciate your cooperation and again ask you to reach out to your child’s teacher, counselor, principal, central office staff member, or any staff member to ensure that we are meeting the needs of your children. All of us have individual situations that we are contending with and we will do our best to try to accommodate you in the best way possible, as we understand that there is not a one-size fits all approach to this public health emergency.

Times like this bring on anxiety and stress for adults as well as for children. Mental Health America has captured many resources that may help people cope with the anxiety, stress and fear associated with the pandemic and promotes emotional wellness. https://mhanational.org/covid19 We also have a link on our website (left side navigation- COVID-19 Information/Guidelines). This link contains valuable resources from different local, state, and federal organizations.

p.span: Please also be reminded of the following:

span.p: -Our buildings and outdoor facilities are closed.
-The Board of Education Office is closed to the public but available to answer any questions or concerns via telephone (201-438-5683) or via e-mail (boardoffice@lyndhurst.k12.nj.us).

-We are currently working on Kindergarten registration to be done online. A separate message will go out regarding when registration will begin. If you know anybody with a child who will turn five no later than October 1st, please have them check our website for specific requirements.

-The Township of Lyndhurst is in the process of completing construction on a state of the art sixth through eighth grade middle school that we plan on opening in September. This joint project is a testament to the generosity of the township and cooperation between both entities.
-Our 2020/2021 school year calendar was approved earlier this year and is available on our website (left side navigation, under Quick Links).
-On April 28th, the Lyndhurst Board of Education Meeting will be done remotely, via Zoom. The public portions of the meeting will be open to the public in a link that will be provided.
-Our district and school websites continue to be updated with relevant information.
We continue to hold out hope that our students can safely return to school in the near future. I wish good health and wellness to all of you and your loved ones.
